activities.loc: Br I Courtroom, 3rd Fl, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kandy K. Howard

records.addlTxt:
10:22 AM Defendant Kandy K. Howard in court. Attorney Megan McGee Norris appeared by video for Kandy K. Howard. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant confused on preliminary hearing. Norris raises the issue of competency. Court in recess 10:26 AM. Back on record 10:31 PM Parties remain same. Court orders a competency evaluation. Schiek/Court statement to probable cause. Schiek statement to statute. Court reviews. Norris has no objection to court proceeding in that way. Court finds probable cause based on her attorney's statement. Bond continued. adj. 10:39 AM
Competency hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

2:37 PM Defendant Kandy K. Howard in court. Attorney Megan McGee Norris appeared by video for Kandy K. Howard. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - will be waiving preliminary hearing. Bail continued. adj. 02:41 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
State's Continued

records.addlTxt: 03:23 PM Defendant Kandy K. Howard in court. Attorney Megan McGee Norris appeared by video for Kandy K. Howard. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Norris states has not been able to contact Defendant - would like to set for another AIA until she can speak with Defendant. Court verifies Defendant's address. Defendant states she has no phone - gives counsel email address. Bail continued. adj. 03:26 PM   Adjourned Initial Appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 2:30 PM
